See also: Oben

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Old High German obana, ultimately from Proto-Germanic *uber.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • audio (Austria)
    		(file)
  • Audio
    		(file)

Adverb[edit]

oben

  1. above
  2. north
  3. upstairs
  4. at an earlier point in a text

Antonyms[edit]

  • unten

Further reading[edit]

  • oben in Duden online

Venetian[edit]

Etymology[edit]

Compare Italian oppure

Conjunction[edit]

oben

  1. either, or

Usage notes[edit]

  • Either duplicated "oben ..... oben" or combined with o "oben ..... o".
